citation.article-title: Thermus filiformis sp. nov., a filamentous caldoactive bacterium.

p.s: Description of Thermus filiformis sp. nov.
Thermus filiformis (fi.li.for'mis. L.n. filum thread; L.n. forma shape; M.L. adj. filiformis thread shaped)
Cells containing yellow carotenoids in coiled trichomes with a diameter of 0.5 to 1.7 μm and of indeterminate length (several hundred micrometers).
Filament width varies; filaments exhibit midfilament and terminal swellings, as well as necridia.
Septa not visible by phase-contrast microscopy.
Heterotrophic, using carbohydrates, organic acids, and amino acids as carbon sources.
The substrates supporting growth include acetate, galactose, glucose, glutamate, mannitol, melibiose, proline, succinate, sucrose, and trehalose.

Unlike Thermus aquaticus and Thermus ruber, Thermus filiformis is nonproteolytic and produces an α-galactosidase. Thermus filiformis does not reduce nitrate or produce deoxyribonuclease but does hydrolyze arbutin and produce a β-galactosidase.
